DataElement.preferredName: Specify Staff Member Responsible For Surgical Message Person Social Role Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information to define the personnel who is responsible for providing the procedure message.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Specify Staff Member Responsible For Surgical Message
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Define the personnel who is responsible for providing the procedure message.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.:The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task.:One of the persons who compose a social group, especially an individual who has joined and participates in a group organization.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task.
One of the persons who compose a social group, especially an individual who has joined and participates in a group organization.

Property.preferredName: Responsible Person For Surgical Procedure Message
Property.preferredDefinition: A person worthy of responsibility or trust or one held accountable.:The reason of something.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A usually short communication transmitted by words, signals, or other means from one person, station, or group to another.

Concepts.definition: A person worthy of responsibility or trust or one held accountable.
The reason of something.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A usually short communication transmitted by words, signals, or other means from one person, station, or group to another.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the role of person who is evaluating or following a patient/participant.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.

Concepts.definition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun on-KOL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in using radiation to treat cancer.

Concepts.definition: A physician who specializes in the treatment of cancer patients, using radiation as the main modality of treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used with organs, tissues, or cells for transplantation from one site to another within the same subject, or from one subject to another of the same species or different species.: Two or more people working together.

Concepts.definition: Used with organs, tissues, or cells for transplantation from one site to another within the same subject, or from one subject to another of the same species or different species.
Two or more people working together.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (on-KOL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in treating cancer.  Some oncologists specialize in a particular type of cancer treatment.  For example, a radiation oncologist specializes in treating cancer with radiation.

Concepts.definition: A physician who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating diseases and disorders of the blood and blood-forming organs.

Concepts.definition: A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating diseases and disorders of the blood and blood-forming organs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A doctor who manages a person's health care over time. A primary care doctor is able to give a wide range of care, including prevention and treatment, can discuss cancer treatment choices, and can refer a patient to a specialist.

Concepts.definition: A medical professional who provides, coordinates, or helps a patient access a range of health care services. This is usually a medical doctor (MD), but may also be a Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine, nurse practitioner, clinical nurse specialist, or physician assistant, as allowed under state law.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.: systematic investigation to establish facts.: A person responsible for organizing multiple events or efforts into a smaller number of tasks.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
systematic investigation to establish facts.
A person responsible for organizing multiple events or efforts into a smaller number of tasks.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: A person skilled in the performance of the technical or procedural aspects of a profession.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A person skilled in the performance of the technical or procedural aspects of a profession.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Registered Nurse (R.N.) - a nurse who has graduated from an accredited registered nursing program, has passed the state exam for licensure, and been registered and licensed to practice by a state authority.  R.N.s receive educational preparation through hospital-based diploma programs, community/junior college associate's degree programs, baccalaureate programs, or combinations thereof.

Concepts.definition: Registered Nurse (R.N.) - a nurse who has graduated from an accredited registered nursing program, has passed the state exam for licensure, and been registered and licensed to practice by a state authority.  R.N.s receive educational preparation through hospital-based diploma programs, community/junior college associate's degree programs, baccalaureate programs, or combinations thereof.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical doctor who provides minimally invasive image-guided diagnosis and treatment of diseases in every organ system

(on-KOL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating cancer using chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, and biological therapy. A medical oncologist often is the main caretaker of someone who has cancer and coordinates treatment provided by other specialists.

Concepts.definition: A doctor who specializes in treating cancer. Some oncologists specialize in a particular type of cancer treatment. For example, a radiation oncologist specializes in treating cancer with radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
